Execution of known data destruction tool.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 4663
Execution of known data destruction tool.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creation with command-line arguments indicating data destruction tools (e.g., sdelete, shred, del /s /q). Monitor Windows Event ID 4663 (if configured) and Sysmon for file creation/modification/deletion events. Analyze events for patterns indicative of mass file operations (e.g., high volume of delete operations from a single process in a short time). Use correlation analysis to link suspicious processes to file modifications.

Anomalously high volume of file deletion.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4663 for deletion events on critical file paths or network shares. Monitor Zeek file.log for file removal events. Calculate the rate of deletion events per host or share over time. Use time series analysis or statistical process control techniques (e.g., EWMA) to detect statistically significant increases in deletion activity compared to historical baseline.
